name: Jo Clinton-Davis
background: Jo Clinton-Davis serves as Controller of Factual at ITV. Focus areas: Overall direction for factual output. They are looking for: High-impact, accessible factual with broad appeal; returning brands.
thematic_priorities: High-impact, accessible documentaries with broad mainstream appeal
Crime documentaries with unique access or perspective
Character-driven factual series with relatable individuals
Access-led documentary series into British institutions or communities
Presenter-led documentary series with established talent
History docs with strong narrative storytelling and broad appeal
Science and natural history accessible to mainstream audiences
Medical documentaries with dramatic storytelling and emotional impact
format_specifications: Preferred Lengths: Singles 60–90'; series 3–6×60' (features 90' where noted)
Series vs. One-off: Both, depending on story and slot
Scheduling: Primetime where applicable; platform premieres for streamers
Platforms: Linear broadcast and/or streaming platform
Typical Episode Counts: 3–10 for series, depending on strand
budget_parameters: Documentary: £100K–£250K per hour; Specialist Factual: £120K–£280K per hour
technical_requirements: Delivery Specifications: Broadcast/streaming standards; details provided upon commissioning
Accessibility: Subtitles/captions; audio description per broadcaster requirements
Graphics & Branding: Adherence to broadcaster branding guidelines
current_calls: Reflect latest broadcaster priorities as outlined above; commissioner-specific interests included.
submission_process: One-page outline with headline, premise and format
additional_info: Increasing focus on distinctive voices and cross-platform reach
